unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Binomial Distribution: Manipulate that Binomial Standard Style
question_text:
A random variable $X$ has the probability:
$$\begin{pmatrix} 20 \\ k \end{pmatrix}(0.44)^{k}(0.56)^{20-k}$$
...associated with the value $k$ is for $k= 0,1,2,3,…,20$.
What is the standard deviation of $X$?
solution:
The formula given in this example is the binomial formula(formula is given on the AP exam):

$$\begin{pmatrix} n \\ k \end{pmatrix}(p)^{k}(1-p)^{n-k}$$

The standard deviation of binomial distribution is given by the formula (formula is given on AP exam):

σ=
√
n⋅p⋅(1−p)

...where p is the probability of a specific outcome and n is the number of samples.

Thus, since n=20 and p=0.44,
σ=
√
20⋅0.44⋅(1−0.44)
=2.22

Choice 'B' is the correct answer.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'A' is incorrect as this represents p⋅(1−p)
. Choice 'C' is incorrect as this represents n⋅p⋅(1−p)
. Choice 'D' is incorrect as this represents n⋅p
which is the mean of a binomial distribution. Choice 'E' is incorrect as this represents n⋅(1−p)
.
